question_text: Which of the following statements accurately describe the DNS hierarchy? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Root servers forward queries to top level domain servers
Subdomains reside above top level domains
The DNS database is distributed across global servers
Every DNS query begins with the gTLD server
FQDNs include host and domain name components
correct_answer: Root servers forward queries to top level domain servers
The DNS database is distributed across global servers
FQDNs include host and domain name components
explanation: The DNS hierarchy starts from the root, flows through TLDs, and down to domains and subdomains; the system is distributed and used to resolve full domain names.
